message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, p53 inactivation is known to be the final mutational step in the progression from adenoma to carcinoma, as it plays a role in preventing abnormal cell growth and promoting cell death. COX-2 overexpression, APC mutation, and SMAD 2/4 loss are also associated with colorectal cancer, but not specifically as the final mutational step in adenoma progression.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The final step in progression from adenoma to carcinoma is p53 inactivation. COX-2 overexpression is associated with inflammation and tumorigenesis but is not the final step. APC mutation and SMAD 2/4 loss are early steps in the progression.

APC mutation and SMAD 2/4 loss are also important in colon cancer development, but they are not the final mutational step.
